channel.title: New Runserver.bat problem
channel.description:
now i gotta new problem (joy) okay, so, like, when I try to run the server it says: ''java' is not recognized as an internal or external command...' But the weird thing is, is that when i try to download JDK it says i already have it and asks if i want to reinstall it, so I just click the 'yes' button and it starts downloading... then it goes backwards opens the wizard, closes itself, then asks me if i wanna reinstall it again! It just keeps on doing that forever, BTW this happens with all the JDK's i try to download. So I bet I'm the only one in the world with this problem and none of you can help me, but what the hell, i'll give it a shot. :D
Don't tell me to just Google it, I've tried that, please just don't.

MY SERVER IS ONLINE NOW!@!!! W00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000T thank you sooooo much dude, i fucking love you!!!

no homo.[/quote]Wow, just wow.

item.title: New Runserver.bat problem
item.dc:creator: @Global_Fear Global Fear
item.description:
@Global_Fear wrote:

Dude. If your jdk is v 11. You have to change the 06 in your class and path variables to 11.

Read full topic

item.title: New Runserver.bat problem
item.dc:creator: @suppyscape suppyscape
item.description:
@suppyscape wrote:

ok, i thought i just fixed it but i didn’t but i finally got my JDK installed i just installed the jdk1.6.0_11 version and my CLASSPATH and PATH are set to

Classpath:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Path:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

Now when i try to run my server it says ‘‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command, program or batch file…’ so yeah… How do i fix this one?

And, i have the latest java, JRE6 :o

Always problems with meh.

Read full topic

item.title: New Runserver.bat problem
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

The should be set to your java and javac.exe, right? Go check them.

Read full topic

item.title: New Runserver.bat problem
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

It’s your environment variables. Make sure they’re referenced correctly (PATH and CLASSPATH)
